body_content.explanation: a machine for forcing particles (= extremely small pieces of matter) to hit each other at high speed so scientists can study what is produced:
examples: Scientists at Cern in Geneva have switched off LEP, the large electron positron collider, after a fruitful 11-year run.
Researchers observed a series of anomalous results on their giant Large Electron Positron (Lep) collider, a 16-mile underground atom smasher drilled underneath Geneva.
